PART 1. 1. TARDIS CORRIDOR OUTSIDE TEGAN’S ROOM
FX: TARDIS HUM. THE DOCTOR KNOCKS LIGHTLY AT THE DOOR
Tegan? Come on, you can’t stay in there all night. (BEAT) Tegan?
Doctor?
She’s locked herself in her room.
It’s my room too.
Yes. I know that, thank you, Nyssa.
FX: HE KNOCKS AGAIN
Come on, Tegan. We want to help.
She’s scared. It was a shock.
Completely understandable, but shutting herself away won’t help. Tegan?
FX: KNOCKS AGAIN
I’m sure she’ll open the door when she’s ready.
That’s hardly the point. Suppose she’s lost consciousness.
Could it be that bad?
Tegan, just tell us that you’re alright.
What’s happening?
Not now, Turlough. Tegan’s not feeling well.
THE CRADLE OF THE SNAKE by Marc Platt Page 3
She’s ill? It’s not contagious, is it?
It’s not a virus if that’s what you mean. Well, not in the
normal sense.
So you do know what it is?
Tegan, if the Mara really is still with you, then we can do something about it. I’1ll get some help.
The Mara? What’s that?
Not now. I’1l explain later.
That would be nice.
Tegan, just one word... please.
You might have to kick the door down.
Not if I can help it.
BEAT
Let me try.
Be my guest.
BEAT
And it might be better if you were to... erm (leave. )
(SIGH) Come on, Turlough. (QUIETLY) We won’t be far.
I’ll be fine, really.
THE CRADLE OF THE SNAKE by Marc Platt Page 4
Why? Is Tegan dangerous?
Come on, Turlough.
(MOVING AWAY) I was only thinking of Nyssa.
FX: NYSSA KNOCKS AT THE DOOR

Tegan, it’s me. The others have gone now. (BEAT) Look, I know it’s difficult, but we’re all worried about you. You can talk to me. You know you can. (BEAT) I was there before remember. On Manussa. I know what you’re going through. So please, just say something.
(FX: AFTER A BEAT, A CHAIR IS PULLED AWAY FROM THE INSIDE. THE
CLICKS. THE DOOR OPENS)
Tegan, thank goodness.
You can’t even begin to know.
2. TARDIS CONTROL ROOM
FX: THE DOCTOR BLIPS BUTTONS
We'll just stay here for a while.
FX: FLIGHT HUM DIES
Where’s here?
Nowhere really. I’ve put the TARDIS in a holding pattern. Better not to go anywhere for the moment.
You're quarantining us. Because of Tegan’s illness.
It’s not an “illness.” Not as such.
THE CRADLE OF THE SNAKE by Marc Platt Page 5
Well, what is it then? Nyssa called it “the Mara?” Is that right?

The Mara, yes. But I’m not really sure how I'd define it. I think perhaps it’s in all of us, deep in our minds. In our darkest thoughts, that’s where it started. Some people call it a demon, but that’s too simple. It’s about temptation. You remember temptation, Turlough. The Devil always finds work for idle hands?
I put that behind me.
Good. Because the Mara’s always looking for a way to be born; to be more than just a nasty thought. It wants to break into our reality. And it delights in mocking order and causing chaos.
FX: SPILLING THINGS OUT OF HIS POCKETS
Now what have I done with that thing?
But what about Tegan? How’s she involved?
Tegan was vulnerable. Not really through her own fault. But the Mara found a way through her troubled dreams into the world.
FX EMPTIES MORE THINGS FROM ANOTHER POCKET
No, not here either. Where have I put it? I’d hoped we’d dealt with the Mara once... but then it came back. And now it’s back again.
How many times?
This is the third appearance. And each time it seems to coil itself tighter.
THE CRADLE OF THE SNAKE by Marc Platt Page 6
3. TARDIS. TEGAN’S ROOM
I suppose I’ve been in denial all this time. Hoping it wasn’t there, you know? Well, I should have known better. I did know. I knew it was there.
Suppose we try and get you help? There are facilities on Terminus... if we could get you there.
I’d give the psychiatrists nervous breakdowns.
Then talk to the Doctor. He’s bound to have ideas.
What’s the point?
Tegan...
Even now you’re looking at me and thinking is that her or the Mara talking.
I know it’s you.
Do you? I’ve been having dreams again too.
FX: MARA STING, AS FIRST HEARD IN Kinda
I know. You’ve been sleeping badly.
Sorry to keep you awake. I suppose you told the Doctor?
No.
Really? There was a time when you’d have been running straight to him. Or our good friend Turlough, now he’s on the straight and narrow.
He’s concerned. We all are.
THE CRADLE OF THE SNAKE by Marc Platt Page 7
(VOICE DARKENING) You’re all so nice and wholesome... and boring.
Tegan...
Always so considerate. What a waste. There are better things to do with the Universe.
(GETTING NERVOUS) I think I should fetch the Doctor... so he knows you’re alright.
Don’t go yet.
FX: TEGAN SHUTS THE DOOR
Please open the door.
Nyssa, you’re always helping other people when you could be helping yourself. Wouldn’t that be better?
That’s not what I believe in. Please let me out.
But there’s so much more. Think about it.
You’re not Tegan.
At last. Well done. You got the direct line to Maraland.
I’m not interested.
Stick with me and you can start to enjoy yourself. Look. Here. See what’s under my sleeve.
FX: RUFFLES UP HER SLEEVE. MARA STING
(SCARED) The sign of the snake.
Isn’t that what you want? (LAUGHS) Of course it is. Don’t resist, Nyssa.
THE CRADLE OF THE SNAKE by Marc Platt
Leave me alone.
Take it!
No!
FX: DOOR BURSTS OPEN
Tegan! Keep away from her!
You! Interfering...!
FX: THE LITTLE MIND’S EYE CRYSTAL RINGS OUT
Remember this, Tegan? The little mind’s eye from Manussa.
LAUGHS
Look at the crystal! Try to focus your thoughts.
It’s just a toy.
Hardly that.
It takes two to play the game, Doctor. Come and find me!
Tegan!
GASPS AND COLLAPSES.
(CATCHING HER) It’s alright. I’ve got her.
She fainted.
Did she? (TEGAN’S HEAVY) Where’s Turlough?
Page 8
THE CRADLE OF THE SNAKE by Marc Platt Page 9
Here, Doctor. Nyssa? Are you alright?
I’1ll be fine.
Help me with Tegan.
Right.
FX: THEY LIFT
Lay her down. That’s it. Nyssa?
How’s her pulse?
Slow.
Her voice was all wrong. Like someone else’s. Not Tegan at all.
We could use the sleep induction box again. That would blot out her dreams.
I think it’s too late for that.
And there’s a snake mark on her arm. Is that the Mara?
Later, Turlough.
Doctor?
You heard what she said.
The game, yes.
It was a challenge. The Mara’s withdrawn into Tegan’s psyche. And it wants me to go in after it.
THE CRADLE OF THE SNAKE by Marc Platt Page 10
4. TEGAN’S ROOM
No. No, move my chair a bit closer.
FX: HEAVY CHAIR SCRAPES FORWARD
Got it. But I still think this is a bad idea.
The Doctor has to do this now. We can’t land the TARDIS. If the Mara got loose on some unsuspecting planet, just think what havoc it would cause.
But going into Tegan’s mind? Rather you than me.
All right, both of you, while I’m asleep...
You want us to stay with you.
Please sit quietly and don’t do anything to wake me. That’s important. I’1ll do that myself.
And suppose Tegan wakes up first?
Just hope it is Tegan.
I won’t let that happen.
It’s still very risky.
Yes, it is. Right. Wish me luck. (BEAT) So... I focus my thoughts through the crystal.
FX: THE CRYSTAL RINGS
(DEEP BREATH) Deeper... deeper... until... I find.. the still point.
(QUIETLY) He’s gone. So quickly.
Nyssa? Look at Tegan. She’s smiling.
THE CRADLE OF THE SNAKE by Marc Platt Page 11
5. TEGAN’S MINDSPACE — CABIN OF A CESSNA LIGHT AIRCRAFT IN
FX: WE HOME IN ON THE BURR OF THE ENGINE
You nearly missed the flight, Doctor. But then time was never your strong point, was it?
Is this Tegan’s plane?
Her Dad's.
Single engine Cessna Skyhawk. I suppose five thousand feet is as good a place to talk as any.
It’s one of her fondest memories. Flying with him over the farm. A couple of thousand Merinos to look out for.
It’s her memory, not yours.
Oh, we’re pretty close, Tegan and me. Hard to prise us apart.
I doubt she has any say in the matter. You’ve been in her mind long enough. It’s time you went back where you came from.
FX: PLANE BANKS SHARPLY
GASPS.
FX: PLANE LEVELS AGAIN
Whoops! Sorry about that. We seem to be hitting a bit of turbulence.
I want you to leave Tegan now.
You’1l have to focus your thoughts better. You can’t just throw the Mara out. It doesn’t work like that. I have to go somewhere.
THE CRADLE OF THE SNAKE by Marc Platt Page 12
I can think of a few places. Just go!
FX: THE CRYSTAL RINGS. THE PLANE BANKS FIERCELY
GASPS.
(OVER ENGINE NOISE) Remember where you are, Doctor!
Tegan! Tegan, can you hear me? Try to fight the Mara!
Oh, please!
FX: CRYSTAL RESONATES. PLANE STILL BANKING
I’1l drive you out. Before you destroy Tegan’s mind completely!
Make me a better offer!
You don’t belong here!
Neither do you! Go and talk to the other sheep!
(FX: DOOR CLUNKS OPEN. THE DOCTOR YELLS INTO THE DISTANCE, FALLING. )
THE CRADLE OF THE SNAKE by Marc Platt Page 13
6. TEGAN’S MINDSPACE — HILLSIDE
FX: THE DOCTOR’S YELL ZOOMS UP. HE HITS THE GROUND.
OOF!
(BEAT. SHEEP BLEATING. TWO SHEEP CALLED NYSSA AND TURLOUGH,
CHEWING GRASS, STAND AND LOOK AT HIM. PRODUCER'S NOTE: IT'LL BE UP TO THE DIRECTOR AND THE ACTORS TO DECIDE HOW MUCH OF A SHEEP VOCAL DELIVERY IS REQUITED! )
It’s that look again.
Indignant. Mortally offended.
Ba-a-a-a-ad news. Always knew he was heading for a fall.
Do you think he’s losing his faculties?
Has been for years. Good thing he landed face down.
If he’d fallen on his back, he’d never be able to stand up again.
The trouble is, he’s always focussed on the top of the hill...
And never notices the be-e-e-e-est grass under his feet.
What are you two sheep staring at? (SITS UP) Oh... typical. That’s my best coat.
& TURLOUGH (REPEATING INTO THE DISTANCE Mu-u-u-u-ud! Mu-u-u-u-ud!
(APPROACHING) Any thoughts, Doctor?
Oh, there you are. Parked your plane, I see. No, no thoughts.
THE CRADLE OF THE SNAKE by Marc Platt Page 14
Then I’1l make you an offer. Tegan is yours if I find a new home.
Meaning what exactly?
Now where shall I go?
FX: BLEATING SHEEP
Hmm. Difficult to choose. Which do you think?
Oh, no. You leave Nyssa and Turloug alone.
You’re right, of course. Who needs all that bleating? When I could go for something a bit more up market... Doctor.
FX: CRYSTAL STARTS TO RING
I want you out of Tegan's mind. Leave her alone.
Remember this? The Mark of the Snake?
FX: MARA STING
Keep away from me. I can resist you!
Can you, Doctor? Really?
Oh, yes. I can resist you. I can drive you out!
THE CRADLE OF THE SNAKE by Marc Platt Page 15
7. TARDIS. TEGAN’S BEDROOM
SLEEPING. HE MOANS. BAD DREAM.
What sort of dream is he having?
I don’t like this, Turlough. I think we should wake him.
He told us not to.
He’s feverish. Suppose he’s in trouble.
Tegan doesn’t seem worried. She’s still well out of it.
I can’t just sit here.
(MUTTER) Tegan! Stay away! No!
Right. That’s it. I'm waking him. I’1ll take the blame.
Careful.
(GENTLY) Doctor? Come on, Doctor. Please wake up. Please.
(WAKING) Leave Tegan alone! (BEAT) Ah... Nyssa...
Doctor, I’m sorry. I had to wake you.
We were both worried. You were yelling as if you were fighting something.
I told you not to wake me!
Is the Mara still there? In Tegan’s mind?
THE CRADLE OF THE SNAKE by Marc Platt Page 16
It was. I was drawing it out into the open. Loosening its grip. But now..? Who knows?
I’m really sorry.
Don’t you ever listen?
We’re both sorry.
So you should be. Look at the crystal.
The Little Mind’s Eye. It’s broken. How did that happen?
Probably when the Mara attacked me. When I tried to drive it out.
Maybe you succeeded. It might have gone.
Gone where?
Tegan’s still asleep. But she’s getting some colour back.
That’s a good sign.
(CHEERFULLY SLEEPY) Hullo... What are you all doing here?
Tegan, hello. How did you sleep?
Like a log, thanks. It was nice.
Any dreams?
Turlough...
Only asking.
THE CRADLE OF THE SNAKE by Marc Platt Page 17
Yes, I was dreaming. I was at the beach eating ice cream. Chocolate and strawberry, like when I was little. You know when it melts faster than you can eat it.
Pleasant dreams then. That’s good.
What happened to your crystal? It’s broken.
Bit of an accident, that’s all. Not to worry. Could I just... look at your arm?
Oh.. The Mara. I forgot. How could I forget that? Did you do something?
I sincerely hope so. There’s no mark on your arm.
There hasn't been for ages actually. Not since last time.
I think you’re much better.
Do you feel better?
Dunno. Maybe. Yes, I suppose I do feel better.
Splendid. Come on then, you two. I’m sure Tegan wants to freshen up.
And I could do with some breakfast.
Me too.
FX: THEY LEAVE
See you later.
FX: DOOR CLOSES
THE CRADLE OF THE SNAKE by Marc Platt Page 18
8. TARDIS CORRIDOR
FX: DOCTOR AND NYSSA WALKING
(QUIETLY) You’re not sure, are you?
I don’t know. What I really need, after tea and a slice of toast, is a second opinion.
Launching Tegan out into an unsuspecting world? Suppose the Mara is still in her?
Well, what can I do? We can’t stay circling in nowhere for ever. Sorry, Nyssa. I have to take the risk.
9. DREAM CHANNEL ADVERT
FX: UPBEAT ADVERT MUSIC
Bored with the same old routine? Had all your hopes dashed?
And your dreams gone flat?
But now the latest technological advances can change all that. Suddenly nothing need be out of reach again.
FX: IN THE BACKGROUND, THE TARDIS LANDS
I believe we’re on the edge of a revolution in therapy and entertainment. And tomorrow night that dream comes true.
I’m Rick ausGarten. Join me tomorrow at eight for Dreamarama, live on the Sundown Channel, when I’1l prove that we are such things as dreams are made of.
And you’ll never be the same again.
THE CRADLE OF THE SNAKE by Marc Platt Page 19
10. TARDIS CONTROL ROOM
FX: TARDIS LANDS. BOING.
Dojjen. Remember him? The old archaeologist on Manussa who went native and joined the snakedancers.
Snakedancers?
Is that where we are? Manussa again?
Yes. I thought we might pop in and see him. Just to catch up. I have so many friends I only ever meet once.
This is for my benefit, isn’t it?
I did hope he might give you a quick check up.
I knew it was too good to last. It’s still there, isn’t it? That “thing?” In my head?
Now Tegan...
FX: SCANNER ACTIVATES
Is that it? Manussa? It’s more advanced than I thought.
Is it? That doesn’t look right.
Typical! He winds me up and then brings me to the wrong place.
No. Definitely Manussa. I set the co-ordinates myself.
Well, look at it. They didn’t have high rise buildings like that.
No, the Doctor’s right. It is Manussa...
THE CRADLE OF THE SNAKE by Marc Platt Page 20
Thank you.
.but the date’s wrong.
Let me see.
If that is Manussa, it’s hundreds of years later.
Actually, it’s much earlier.
Earlier?
Alright. Which of you touched the controls?
Well, don’t look at me.
Certainly not.
Nor me.

Well, whoever’s responsible, they’ve landed us centuries before I planned. And the planet is far more advanced. This is the Manussan Empire, long before its subjugation and decline under the terrible yoke of the Mara.
FX: MARA STING
THE CRADLE OF THE SNAKE by Marc Platt Page 21
11. RICK AUSGARTEN’S WAREHOUSE
FX: CAGED BIRDS SINGING, SQUAWKING
(FEEDING A BIRD) Come on, beaky. Take it. That’s it...
(APPROACHING) Baala!
Over here, Mr ausG.
Get a move on, Baala. It’s ten to noon already. She’ll be here any minute.
But I’ve still to feed the birds and animals. It upsets them if their routine goes wrong.

And keep this warehouse locked. The Safety Officer, Mrs... “Rayluss”, is only checking the studio. Not out here. One glimpse of the livestock and she’1ll shut us down anyway. I thought we’d give her a run through of tomorrow’s show.
You know the old man’s back.
What?
Dadda Desaka.
Not again. I thought you got rid of him.
He’s sitting out the front, protesting. He’s even got a placard. He says we’re committing blasphemy. All our work and the show.
This is your fault, Baala. If you hadn’t given him food... He’s not another pet; he’s a damn nuisance.
The Dadda’s a mystic.
THE CRADLE OF THE SNAKE by Marc Platt Page 22
He’s a grubby old tramp who wandered down from the hills. I’m getting him moved on.
You can’t. He’s a native Manussan holy man. He’s protected by law.
Tell you what: we’1ll invite him on the show and see what his holy thoughts look like. If that doesn’t grab the ratings, nothing will.
I don’t think he’1ll consent to that.
FX: BUZZER
Ah, not already. That’1ll be the Officer. You close this place up. I’ll honey her round the studio. By the time we’re done, it’ll have the cleanest safety bill ever.
12. EXT. PARK
(FX: CHILDREN PLAYING. PASSERS-BY. IT’S A SUNNY AND HAPPY PLACE. )
It’s really not so bad here.
You almost sound convinced.
Well, I figured that since I know I didn’t change the coordinates, then it’s not my problem. So I’m going to enjoy myself. It’s a long time since I sat in a park and did nothing.
It wasn’t me that altered the coordinates either.
I don’t think it was any of us. Just the Doctor making a slip. It’s easily done.
Where is he anyway?
He went to make some enquiries.
THE CRADLE OF THE SNAKE by Marc Platt Page 23
Mm, this is more like it. Palm trees, fountains. I could sit here all day and soak up the sun. If I had money, I’d buy us all ice creams.
I’m going for a stroll.
Don’t go too far.
(MOVING OFF) I won’t.
Turlough’s nervous. He won’t sit still.
He’s always nervous. And with good cause this time.
Tegan, you don’t mean it was him.
Why not? If the Mara has left me...
Tegan...
Which it has. Then surely Turlough’s the obvious place for it to go. He must have interfered.
I wouldn’t say that without proof. I’m nervous too. What does that tell you?
(ARRIVING) It’s very pleasant here. Just the spot for a rest.
Hello. Did you find what you wanted?
I did indeed. Whatever Manussa’s future’s like, it’s certainly a thriving and enlightened world just now. And tomorrow is New Year. Fancy that. I expect there’1l be parties.
That’1ll be good.
Where’s Turlough?
THE CRADLE OF THE SNAKE by Marc Platt Page 24
Mooching about somewhere.

Right. Well, the information office was very helpful. They’ve put me in touch with an eminent neuroscientist. Doctor Honri Kerrem at the Faculty of Advancement. And he’s agreed to give you a thorough check up, Tegan.
That’s a wonderful idea.
Yes, I think so. Tegan?
Okay. Fine.
You’re not even going to argue?
Not if it proves to you what I already know.
Good, good. It’s just across town, so we’ll need to take a tuk- tuk. Nyssa, you and Turlough can wait here. We’1ll only be a couple of hours.
All right. Good luck, Tegan. I’1l go and tell Turlough now.
FX: FOUNTAINS PLAY
Nyssa?
The Doctor’s taken Tegan to see a specialist.
I saw them go. I hope he gets danger money.
BEAT
Look, are you all right? You’ve gone very edgy.
You think I’m “infected”, don’t you? But I’m not. Really I’m not.. You know that, don’t you?
I don’t know, Turlough. You tell me.
THE CRADLE OF THE SNAKE by Marc Platt Page 25
13. EXT. ABOARD THE TUK-TUK
FX: BUZZY CHUG OF THE TUK-TUK THROUGH TRAFFIC
This is certainly the way to see the city. Everyone living their lives on the street, like an endless market.
Is this going to be okay, Doctor?
I think so. Doctor Kerrem assured me that he has the most advanced techniques in neural probes and crystal scanning. And I’ll be there with you. It’ll be fine.
I think I’d rather have a private consultation.
If you like, but I won’t be far away. I promise.
I do appreciate it, you know. Even if I do come over like all spiky and moaning.
You, Tegan? Surely not. You’ve had a horrible time. Let’s get this cleared once and for all.
(FX: A TALKING BILLBOARD WITH THE VOICE OF RICK PASSES THEM.
MUSIC)
(DISTORT) Have all your dreams gone flat? Well, I aim to make them all come true.
What is that?
Some sort of advert.
(DISTORT) I’m Rick ausGarten. Join me tomorrow at eight, New Year’s Eve, for Dreamarama, live on the Sundown Channel. Look into the crystal. Your dreams will never be the same again.
(SCARED) My dreams? Doctor, promise me that’s not where we’re going.
THE CRADLE OF THE SNAKE by Marc Platt Page 26
14. INT. RICK’S STUDIO
RAYLUSS FINISHES HER SAFETY AUDIT.
Well, the studio seems to be in order, Mr ausGarten. Once you’ve attended to the door in the isolation chamber, that is.
Right. Well erm, thanks, Mrs Rayluss. You’ve been very helpful. I’1l show you out.
My real concern is the subjects, the members of public taking part in the experiment. They should undergo a full health check beforehand.
Yeah, well, that’s not so easy. Coz it’s live, there’s the element of surprise. Anyone can get chosen.
I do see that as a problem. “Matter realisation?” Is that what you call it?
Pure thought goes into the crystal and comes out as living matter. It’s easy. No ill effects.
I know it’s an illusion, like a rabbit out of a hat.
No, no. Don’t mock it. Our process is scientifically proven. We've done over eight hundred test runs. It’s amazing and fun. It’s bringing science to the people.
Not to everyone, it seems. I thought that alarming old tribesman outside was going to throw something. He swore you were cursed and you’d bring all sorts of horrors down on the CLlys
All publicity is good publicity.
And a lot of people believe that stuff. We don’t want a disaster. Not on live transmission.
Tell you what. Why don’t you have a go?
THE CRADLE OF THE SNAKE by Marc Platt Page 27
I don’t think so.
Why not? What better proof than if you’ve done it yourself? Come on. Can I call you Yoanna? Think of something you’d like.
Well, I confess I am intrigued.
Right then. It’s already on standby. So sit yourself in the Chair of Dreams...
The Chair of Dreams? Oh, well. I suppose...
FX: SHE SITS
Lovely. Now we’1ll run a quick scan into the old electric crystal to map out your brain potential. And then let’s see what you can think into existence.
15. DR KERREM’S CONSULTANCY
Now Tegan, are you comfortable?
I guess so.
The skullcap not too tight?
Fine. Thanks, Dr Kerrem.
Good. Now the blue crystal here in the neuro-imagevr...
It’s like the Mind’s Eye.
I’m sorry?
The Doctor... he had something like it.
THE CRADLE OF THE SNAKE by Marc Platt Page 28
Your companion?
Yes.
He seemed a knowledgeable fellow. Well read for one so young.
He is. I mean, he’s not as young as you think, but don’t tell him I said that.

Right. So the crystal will scan your brain in multi-modal detail. In particular, the cerebral cortex and hippocampus: what we think of as the “aware areas.” It’1ll highlight any abnormalities or disturbances — any extra activity that might be causing you to dream.
Okay.
Right. You may feel a slight tingling, a little like itching on the inside, but that’s nothing to worry about. So, ready, Tegan?
Ready.
16. RICK’S STUDIO YOANNA IN THE CHAIR.
FX: RICK’S DREAM MAKER STARTS TO PULSE WITH POWER
Dreammaker now scanning.
Just relax, Yoanna. This only takes a few moments.
Scan complete. Thoughts are now compatible.
Thanks, Baala. Okay. You remember what you wanted to visualise?
THE CRADLE OF THE SNAKE by Marc Platt Page 29
I do.
Don’t tell us. Just think of it now. In detail. And don’t change your mind halfway through.
I’m thinking.
Good.
FX: THE MACHINE STARTS TO THRUM
Image forming in isolation chamber.
Here it comes. It’s a flower. Yes?
